hero.subtitle: Orchestrate logic, drive data, and transmute inspiration into code.

newResource.title: Create New
newResource.subtitle: Select a type and start building

ux01.title: Write the user story first
ux01.body: Before sketching, write one sentence describing what this screen helps users accomplish.

ux02.title: Keep blueprints focused
ux02.body: One blueprint, one job. Split complex flows into smaller blueprints to avoid visual overload.

ux03.title: Work backwards from the outcome
ux03.body: Start by visualizing the end state, then trace back each step users need to take.

ux04.title: Name nodes in plain language
ux04.body: Use action names users understand like 'Submit Form', and avoid abbreviations.

ux05.title: Minimize wire spaghetti
ux05.body: Use grouping and aliases to reduce crossing wires—keep your canvas clean.

ux06.title: Group state nodes together
ux06.body: Cluster state nodes in one area so you can see what changes at a glance.

ux07.title: Pin frequent tools nearby
ux07.body: Favorite common components and blueprints at the top to reduce scrolling.

ux08.title: Use clear component previews
ux08.body: Give custom components recognizable thumbnails to avoid picking the wrong one.

ux09.title: Write realistic placeholder text
ux09.body: Even placeholder copy should be close to real content to test flow and clarity.

ux10.title: Save or commit often
ux10.body: After each small change, save or commit so you can roll back easily if needed.

ux11.title: Color-code node categories
ux11.body: Use colors to distinguish data, view, and interaction nodes—let color guide you.

ux12.title: Make error messages specific
ux12.body: Don't just say 'Error'. Tell users exactly what's wrong and how to fix it.

ux13.title: Enable alignment guides
ux13.body: Turn on snap-to-edge guides so components align crisply and consistently.

ux14.title: Use layout components first
ux14.body: Start with grids and flex containers, then fill in details—responsive design gets easier.

ux15.title: Test mobile view early
ux15.body: Preview at phone size at least once to catch 'can't tap' or 'too cramped' issues early.

ux16.title: Design complete button states
ux16.body: Don't stop at normal state—test hover, pressed, and disabled to ensure consistency.

ux17.title: Don't load everything at once
ux17.body: For long lists, add pagination or lazy loading—don't make users scroll endlessly.

ux18.title: Show loading feedback
ux18.body: Any operation over one second deserves a visible loading indicator.

ux19.title: Break up intimidating forms
ux19.body: Split multi-part forms into steps with a progress bar so users know what's left.

ux20.title: Test with real data structures
ux20.body: Use mock data with realistic structure to catch field naming and layout issues.

ux21.title: Extract reusable logic
ux21.body: Turn common logic into blueprint fragments or function nodes—don't copy-paste.

ux22.title: Add notes as you go
ux22.body: Drop a quick comment next to key nodes—future you will be grateful.

ux23.title: Keep interaction paths short
ux23.body: From entry to outcome, aim for 3-5 steps to keep users moving smoothly.

ux24.title: Design thoughtful empty states
ux24.body: When lists are empty, show friendly guidance instead of blank space.

ux25.title: Use smart defaults
ux25.body: Set sensible defaults for common choices so users can skip a step.

ux26.title: Confirm destructive actions
ux26.body: Add a confirmation dialog for delete or reset, and explain the consequences.

ux27.title: Always provide a next step
ux27.body: On success screens, offer 'Go back' or 'Continue next' instead of just a close button.

ux28.title: Walk through your own flow
ux28.body: Before launch, complete a real task with your UI and note any friction.

ux29.title: Support keyboard navigation
ux29.body: Add shortcuts for common actions so power users don't need to reach for the mouse.

ux30.title: Make error messages copyable
ux30.body: Let users copy error text with one click for easier troubleshooting.

ux31.title: Position tooltips carefully
ux31.body: Place hover hints where they won't block key information.

ux32.title: Remember scroll position
ux32.body: When users return to a list, restore their scroll position.

ux33.title: Don't rely on color alone
ux33.body: Add icons or text labels to help colorblind users distinguish states.

ux34.title: Name components by purpose
ux34.body: Use 'purpose + context' names like 'Primary Button / Dialog Confirm'.

ux35.title: Keep sidebars clean
ux35.body: Collapse advanced settings so beginners aren't overwhelmed at first glance.

ux36.title: Build the happy path first
ux36.body: Perfect the most typical user journey before handling edge cases.

ux37.title: Arrange nodes logically
ux37.body: Flow nodes left-to-right in the order users think—reduce future reading cost.

ux38.title: Group nodes like a story
ux38.body: Structure as 'fetch data → process → display' to make blueprints tell a clear story.

ux39.title: Start from templates
ux39.body: For similar pages, clone a template instead of starting from scratch.

ux40.title: Ask 'then what?' at every step
ux40.body: For each screen, ask what users naturally do next, then provide that path.

ux41.title: Progressively disclose options
ux41.body: Show only required fields at first, hide advanced config behind 'Show more'.

ux42.title: Keep heavy nodes async
ux42.body: Run long computations asynchronously to avoid locking up the entire UI.

ux43.title: Match preview to production
ux43.body: Use production-like settings in preview to avoid 'works here, breaks live' surprises.

ux44.title: Put docs near the canvas
ux44.body: Add a doc link directly in the properties panel so users don't hunt for help.

ux45.title: Use whitespace to guide eyes
ux45.body: Don't fear empty space—give key buttons breathing room.

ux46.title: Keep default themes simple
ux46.body: Limit theme colors to two or three—let content shine, not the palette.

ux47.title: Align consistently
ux47.body: Within a page, align titles, body text, and buttons to a common baseline.

ux48.title: Enable column sorting
ux48.body: Let users sort and filter tables by column to find key data quickly.

ux49.title: Validate input in real-time
ux49.body: Show errors as users type, not after they submit everything.

ux50.title: Plan for localization
ux50.body: Leave extra length for text so layouts don't break when switching languages.

ux51.title: Make errors visible, not scary
ux51.body: Highlight error nodes in red, but use conversational language instead of 'CRITICAL ERROR'.

ux52.title: Write human commit messages
ux52.body: Describe what changed and for whom, not just 'fix'.

ux53.title: Agree on naming conventions
ux53.body: Before collaborating, establish node and component naming rules to avoid confusion.

ux54.title: Show collaborator presence
ux54.body: Display other users' cursors and actions on canvas to prevent conflicts.

ux55.title: Visualize merge conflicts
ux55.body: Use visual diffs instead of raw JSON when merging changes.

ux56.title: Always show next steps
ux56.body: New users should always see a suggested next action button.

ux57.title: Skip pointless confirmations
ux57.body: Don't confirm actions that are easily undone—save users' clicks.

ux58.title: Build a blueprint library
ux58.body: Package common workflows as reusable blueprints for the whole team.

ux59.title: Name styles semantically
ux59.body: Use 'primary action' instead of 'blue' so themes can change easily.

ux60.title: Organize by user tasks
ux60.body: Structure navigation by scenarios, not tech modules, so non-devs can navigate too.

ux61.title: Collapse long property panels
ux61.body: Break parameter lists into sections to avoid endless scrolling.

ux62.title: Add magnetic drop zones
ux62.body: Make drop targets slightly magnetic so beginners land components correctly.

ux63.title: Keep preview button visible
ux63.body: Ensure the preview button is accessible no matter which panels are open.

ux64.title: Keep undo granular
ux64.body: Undo should revert one meaningful action, not fifty steps at once.

ux65.title: Test before exporting
ux65.body: Click through key interactions in the editor before exporting code.

ux66.title: Fail gracefully
ux66.body: When requests fail, keep existing data instead of clearing the screen.

ux67.title: Use skeleton screens
ux67.body: Show skeleton placeholders while loading lists or cards—better than blank.

ux68.title: Avoid jargon in messages
ux68.body: Say 'Save failed, check network' instead of 'Request timeout'.

ux69.title: Think device, not pixels
ux69.body: Set responsive breakpoints by 'phone/tablet/desktop', not exact widths.

ux70.title: Allow rollback on overrides
ux70.body: For any config override, provide a one-click undo.

ux71.title: Optimize mouse travel
ux71.body: Place 'Save' and 'Publish' along common cursor paths to reduce movement.

ux72.title: Provide empty state templates
ux72.body: Offer drag-and-drop empty state templates for common scenarios.

ux73.title: Group table actions on the right
ux73.body: Put row actions in one column instead of scattering them across cells.

ux74.title: Avoid nested scrollbars
ux74.body: Try not to have more than one scrollable area on screen at once.

ux75.title: Fix blueprint entry position
ux75.body: Keep main entry nodes in the top-left so they're easy to find.

ux76.title: Use icons to speed recognition
ux76.body: Give node categories consistent icons—eventually you won't need to read labels.

ux77.title: Remember panel collapse state
ux77.body: Let the panel remember which sections users prefer collapsed.

ux78.title: Warn on unsaved exit
ux78.body: If users close with unsaved changes, gently remind them.

ux79.title: Design nodes with use cases
ux79.body: Before adding a new node type, write two typical use cases to avoid bloat.

ux80.title: Show plugin permissions clearly
ux80.body: When installing plugins, explicitly list what data they access.

ux81.title: Show debug info side-by-side
ux81.body: Display debug logs next to the canvas instead of forcing context switching.

ux82.title: Filter logs by user task
ux82.body: Let users filter debug logs by session or action chain for faster troubleshooting.

ux83.title: Mock data shouldn't be perfect
ux83.body: Include some edge cases in test data to see if your UI can handle them.

ux84.title: Flag slow operations
ux84.body: Mark known slow nodes so designers avoid chaining too many in sequence.

ux85.title: Animate to clarify, not decorate
ux85.body: Only use animation to explain state changes—don't slow users down for aesthetics.

ux86.title: Keep color meanings consistent
ux86.body: Green always means success, red always means danger—never mix them.

ux87.title: Limit nav depth to three
ux87.body: If menus go deeper than three levels, rethink your information architecture.

ux88.title: Support fuzzy search
ux88.body: Let node and component search handle typos, pinyin, or partial matches.

ux89.title: Put help where it's needed
ux89.body: Add a '?' icon next to complex panels that links directly to relevant docs.

ux90.title: Make configs shareable
ux90.body: Allow one-click sharing of build configs so teams stay aligned.

ux91.title: Focus the first screen
ux91.body: When users enter the editor, guide them to complete one simple, full task.

ux92.title: Include a sample project
ux92.body: New workspaces should include a deletable example to help users explore.

ux93.title: Make history searchable
ux93.body: In complex debugging, let users search operation history by keyword.

ux94.title: Auto-fit canvas to content
ux94.body: Adjust canvas zoom so the whole blueprint structure is visible from the start.

ux95.title: Include comments in exports
ux95.body: Generated code should include blueprint-linked comments for easier dev handoff.

ux96.title: Document failure modes
ux96.body: In docs, include 'don't do this' examples to help users avoid common pitfalls.

ux97.title: Always provide an escape hatch
ux97.body: No matter how complex, users should always be able to 'Go home' or 'Undo'.

ux98.title: Enable Enter to submit
ux98.body: For common forms, let keyboard users press Enter to submit.

ux99.title: Switch views by role
ux99.body: Offer different node panel views for designers, devs, and ops to reduce noise.

ux100.title: Respect existing habits
ux100.body: Match layouts and interactions to patterns users already know—reduce migration cost.

editorPage.title: Editor Settings
editorPage.subtitle: Global defaults applied to every project and new workspace.

projectPage.title: Project Settings
projectPage.subtitle: Project-specific configuration with optional global overrides.

overrides.title: Overrides
overrides.body: Toggle a row to override the global default for this project.

appearance.title: Appearance & Language
appearance.description: Defaults that shape the editor look and feel for every workspace.

behavior.title: Editor behavior
behavior.description: How the editor saves, confirms, and manages your work.

blueprint.title: Blueprint defaults
blueprint.description: Defaults applied when creating or opening a new blueprint.

components.title: Components & rendering
components.description: Control how MIR resolves and renders components.

codegen.title: Code generation
codegen.description: Defaults for exported code and artifacts.

language.label: Interface language
language.description: Primary locale for menus, panels, and tooltips.

theme.label: Theme preference
theme.description: Pick the default color mode for the editor.

density.label: Density
density.description: Control spacing and compactness for the workspace.

fontScale.label: Font scale
fontScale.description: Scale typography across the editor UI.

undoSteps.label: Undo steps
undoSteps.description: Maximum steps stored in the undo stack.

panelLayout.label: Default panel layout
panelLayout.description: Choose the baseline layout for editor panels.

viewportSize.label: Viewport size
viewportSize.description: Default artboard size for new pages.

zoomStep.label: Zoom step
zoomStep.description: Zoom increment when scrolling or pressing shortcuts.

panInertia.label: Pan inertia
panInertia.description: Momentum applied after dragging the canvas.

resolverOrder.label: Resolver order
resolverOrder.description: Lookup priority when multiple registries exist.

renderMode.label: Render mode
renderMode.description: Choose strict validation or tolerant rendering.

externalProps.label: External props
externalProps.description: Allow runtime props injection for previews.

defaultFramework.label: Default framework
defaultFramework.description: Primary target for generated UI code.

metadata.label: Metadata comments
metadata.description: Include MIR metadata annotations in output.

diagnostics.label: Diagnostics overlay
diagnostics.description: Show visual debugging cues on the canvas.

basics.title: Project basics
basics.description: Identity and defaults unique to this project.

collaboration.title: Collaboration
collaboration.description: Access, permissions, and team workflow defaults.

designSystem.title: Design system
designSystem.description: Project-specific UI tokens and asset libraries.

integrations.title: Integrations & environments
integrations.description: Data sources, auth, and environment settings.

build.title: Build & export
build.description: Project export configuration and build options.

name.label: Project name
name.description: Display name shown in navigation and exports.

defaultRoute.label: Default route
defaultRoute.description: Landing path when opening the project.

timezone.label: Timezone
timezone.description: Used for logs, scheduling, and timestamps.

themeTokenSet.label: Theme token set
themeTokenSet.description: Token pack used to render colors and spacing.

componentLibraryVersion.label: Component library version
componentLibraryVersion.description: Pinned version of shared MDR components.

assetHost.label: Asset host
assetHost.description: Primary CDN or asset bucket URL.

fontPack.label: Font pack
fontPack.description: Font families available in the design system.

iconSet.label: Icon set
iconSet.description: Default icon pack for UI templates.

apiBase.label: API base URL
apiBase.description: Primary API endpoint for data requests.

schemaVersion.label: Schema version
schemaVersion.description: Pinned MIR schema for this project.

customNodes.label: Custom nodes
customNodes.description: Allowed custom node types in graphs.

autoMigrate.label: Auto-migrate
autoMigrate.description: Automatically migrate MIR when schema updates.

triggers.targetHelp: Browser tab target used by navigation actions.
triggers.stateHelp: Optional navigation state. Plain text or JSON string.
